item.title: Could anyone explain what is php and mysql?
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

PHP is code parsed before the user goes to a webpage and isn’t available when you view the source. Instead of you parsing the code, the server parses the code. It’s very useful when making counters, php games, a whole website, and other stuff. Such as you can make 5 files called head.php, side1.php, body.php, side2.php, and footer.php and you can include each one of those files in all of your pages.

That way you don’t have to edit each page, you can just edit one page, and that part of a page will get included in all your pages lol.

MySQL is a database used to make more complicated PHP scripts such as logins and other scripts to store data into the database and draw it back out later.

Hope that helps.

~Ron

Read full topic
item.source: Could anyone explain what is php and mysql?
